text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 21.5.10, Account Resolution, Examination Issues.

IRM 21.5.10.4.1.2(3) Eliminated option to forward correspondence cases with AQC involvement via mail. Change made to increase efficiency in processing taxpayer responses. IPU 22U0407 issued 03-18-2022.
Exhibit 21.5.10-1 Removed note for procedures for Pass Through Entity and TEFRA cases. Change made as Field Exam does not work those cases.

Exhibit 21.5.10-2 Corrected name to Pass Through Entities, updated EGC code, added Statuses 24 and 33 for Pass Through Entity and TEFRA Exam cases. Change based on departmental and programming updates. IPU 21U1162 issued 10-12-2021.

Exhibit 21.5.10-2 Changes to Statuses 00, 06, and 10. Status 00 separated out and added procedures if taxpayer has received and has questions concerning Exam letter. Changes made due to availability of information based on Status Code. IPU 22U0602 issued 05-10-2022.
Exhibit 21.5.10-2 Added to Status 24 if less than 90 days and taxpayer has not provided information, not to transfer if there is no address change. Change made for IRM clarity.
Editorial changes were made throughout the IRM for clarity. Reviewed and updated plain language, grammar, web addresses, IRM references, and legal references.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

IRM 21.5.10 Account Resolution, Examination Issues, dated August 20, 2021 (effective October 1, 2021), is superseded. This IRM incorporates Interim Procedural Updates (IPU): IPU 21U1162 (effective 10-12-2021), IPU 22U0407 (effective 03-18-2022), and IPU 22U0602 (effective 05-10-2022).

A TC 810 or TC 570 indicates a stopped/frozen refund. TC 810 or TC 570 is used by Exam or Automated Questionable Credit (AQC) if a taxpayer’s return is under review or the previous review is not closed. If the taxpayer does not claim the same items on a subsequent return, the refund is released in most cases. Consider a referral to Taxpayer Advocate Services in instances where the taxpayer indicates there is an economic hardship.

Use Audit Information Management System (AIMS) status codes to determine how to respond to the taxpayer for Exam related issues. EITC only EITC and Additional Child Tax Credit (ACTC) EITC and Premium Tax Credit (PTC) EITC and American Opportunity Tax Credit (AOTC) PTC only American Opportunity Tax Credit only Or other various audit combinations (e.g., EITC, ACTC, PTC, AOTC)
Once Examination’s review is complete, a second TC 811 posts to release the EITC, ACTC, AOTC, or the PTC portion of the refund if applicable.

) Individual Master File (IMF) Audit Reconsideration is the process the IRS uses to reevaluate the results of a prior audit where additional tax was assessed and remains unpaid, or a tax credit was reversed. Examination cases closed as Non-Examined with no additional tax assessed do not meet the deﬁnition and criteria of an Audit Reconsideration. Do not route to Exam. Refer to IRM
, Research/Initial Case Screening, through IRM
, Reconsidera- tion Calls Received in Exam Operation, for information to determine if the case meets audit reconsideration criteria. Refer to IRM

, Function Respon- sible & Routing Instructions, for routing instructions. Taxpayers requesting reconsideration typically have a balance due and may require holds on collec- tion action. If the taxpayer is inquiring about the status of their reconsideration request, refer to IRM
, Role of Contact Employees when a Reconsid- eration Request is Received and the Examination was Performed in the Area Office or Campus Examination Function.
